title: Chemical State Analysis of Low-Z Elements by X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy (XPS)
content: X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) is a surface analysis technique capable of providing elemental and chemical state information from the outer 5 to 10 nanometres of a solid surface. All elements from lithium to uranium can be detected with detection limits ranging from 0.1 to 3 atomic percent (element dependent). When an X-ray of known energy (hν), for example Al(Kα) at 1486.7eV, interacts with an atom, a photoelectron can be emitted via the photoelectric effect.
